resources.string: "My name is Ketevan (Ketato) Abuladze, and I am from Georgia, a beautiful country in the Caucasus region. I am 21 years old, soon turning 22. I came to NYC to pursue my studies in computer science. My childhood dream was to become a professional tennis player, but unfortunately, due to health issues, I had to give up on that dream. However, I've found a new passion in computer science and aspire to be successful in this field. I have two brothers, one older and one younger. Interestingly, both the age gaps between me and my older brother and between me and my younger brother are 7 years. My family still resides in Georgia, and while I miss them dearly, I cherish the time we spend together during vacations."

"I have a variety of hobbies that keep me engaged and entertained. One of my passions is playing tennis, where I find joy and excitement in the fast-paced nature of the sport. Additionally, I enjoy the serene experience of riding horses, feeling the connection between myself and the magnificent animal beneath me. In quieter moments, you'll often find me engrossed in a good book, exploring new worlds and ideas through the pages. For a bit of excitement and competition, I also indulge in playing video games, where I can immerse myself in virtual adventures. Photography is another hobby close to my heart, especially film photography, where I relish the process of capturing moments on analog film and the anticipation of seeing the final images. And of course, I love spending time in the kitchen, experimenting with different ingredients and flavors to create delicious meals for myself and others. These hobbies bring balance and fulfillment to my life, offering both excitement and relaxation in equal measure."
